fields.description:
Sometimes teams have a space or page(s) which are view only to extended team members.

These teams sometimes need to assign tasks to these view only users, however they are unable to mark their task as complete.

It would be convenient to allow view only users to check off tasks which they are assigned.

Example of a real use case:

Every team/group has it's own space. Each space is open for edit for the team, and for view for all the employees.
Most of the meeting minutes are cross-team. So a team member that called the meeting is writing a meeting summary in his space, and assigns tasks to other people form other teams. Those people have only view permission of the space, but they were allocated a task. they cannot mark this task as complete.
fields.summary: Allow users with view only permissions to check off tasks that they are assigned

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Upgrading to Confluence 7.13.0 will fail when the database name involves a hyphen in MySQL Database

h3. Environment
* MySQL 8.0
* JDBC driver *8.0.22*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup MySQL 8.0 per [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf710/database-setup-for-mysql-1031840907.html] documentation
# Install Confluence 7.10.0 with MySQL 
# Create the Confluence database name with a hyphen (-) in it such as *confl7100-test*
# Stop Confluence and upgrade to Confluence to 7.13.0

h3. Expected Results
Confluence is upgraded successfully

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When Confluence Base URL contains a context path with an Uppercase char, the Analytics plugin is not reachable from Header menu.

h3. Environment
Reproduced locally with Confluence *Data Center* version *7.13.0*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set context path to */Confluence* In <install-dir>/conf/server.xml
{code}<Context path="/Confluence" docBase="../confluence" debug="0" reloadable="false" useHttpOnly="true">{code}
# Restart Confluence 
# Access the Confluence Web UI for instance from the Confluence server locally on endpoint http://localhost:8090/Confluence 
# On the Confluence UI header menu, click on *Analytics* to reproduce the error message (screenshot attached). 
#* (i) Alternatively you can try to browse to http://<confluenceServerIP>:<Port>/Confluence/plugins/confanalytics/analytics.action#/analytics/instance/overview to reproduce the error directly

h3. Expected Results
The Analytics plugin should be reachable when Confluence is accessed with a context path that contains an Uppercase char (/)

h3. Actual Results
The Analytics plugin is not reachable when Confluence is accessed with a context path that contains an Uppercase char (x)

h3. Workaround
An option can be to *change the context path so that it doesn't contain uppercase value* (from /Confluence to /confluence for instance)
* This will involve updating (whilst Confluence is shut down):
** <confluence-home>/confluence.cfg.xml - update the /Confluence to /confluence
** <confluence-install>/conf/server.xml - update the /Confluence to /confluence
* Once Confluence is up and running, navigate to Confluence Administration » General Configuration and update the Base URL so that it includes the new context path in lowercase /confluence
* (!) changing the context path could affect any bookmarks or application link integrations

h3. Notes
N/A
fields.summary: Analytics Plugin not accessible when Confluence Tomcat Context Path contains an Uppercase char
Livesearch button not rendering properly in Confluence regardless of the size of sidebar.

fields.description:
When performing a Custom Space Export to PDF for a specific subset of pages, both {{contentToBeExported}} and {{contentToBeExcluded}} parameters are used for content calculation.
This is usually not a problem for smaller spaces, but can cause performance problems for large spaces (i.e 20k+ pages), because if you only pick 2k pages to be exported, flyingpdf will use {{contentToBeExported}} to calculate the 2k pages, but would also use {{contentToBeExcluded}} parameter to calculate and list 18k pages not to be exported, making the whole process significantly longer and more process intensive, than it needs to be.
{{contentToBeExcluded}} parameter is not used by PDF export plugin because the resulting content tree is created by filtering with the {{contentToBeExported}} alone, so it should be excluded from calculations.
fields.summary: contentToBeExcluded property should not be calculated in custom PDF export

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The browser does not display the editor layout nicely in edit mode when the browser zoom is not set to default (100%)
h3. Environment

Windows 10
 * Chrome
 * MS Edge

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Have browser zoom level set to 120% or 150% (non-default)
 * Open a page in edit mode
 * The editor layout is not displayed properly as shown in the screenshot

h3. Expected Results

The editor layout appears normal.
h3. Actual Results

The editor layout displayed only a partial editor window with scroll bars.
h3. Workaround

_This issue is not seen in Mozilla Firefox._
h3. Notes

This issue occurs when a web browser is set to zoom in or zoomed out a few levels.
fields.summary: Improper Editor Layout in Browser Due to Browser Settings

fields.description:
As of now, Confluence does not have a feature to sort users/groups in Space Permission and Global Permission page alphabetically. It would be easier to check the users/groups name if it is possible to sort the names alphabetically.
 !image102.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Sort users/groups alphabetically in Space Permissions page

fields.description: If SQL logging is enabled during the operation of the reconcile unknown attachments plugin, it's evident that the same query to count the number of attachments on the page is repeated multiple times. This heavily impacts page load times depending on the number of embedded attachments on the page and the number of attachments associated with the page overall.
fields.summary: Improve reconcile unknown attachments plugin performance for pages with many attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The following message will accompany some LDAP syncs:
{code:java}
Could not synchronise transactional cache [com.atlassian.confluence.user.crowd.CachedCrowdUserDao.USER_CACHE]. Attempting flush instead.{code}
h3. Environment
Data Center

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [Run Confluence in DC mode|https://bulldogwiki.internal.atlassian.com/wiki/display/CONFSERVER/How+to+run+Confluence+DC+locally]
 # Set up LDAP using [this how to|https://bulldogwiki.internal.atlassian.com/wiki/display/CONFSERVER/How+to+setup+LDAP+server+on+local+machine].
 # [Connect Confluence to LDAP directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/connecting-to-an-ldap-directory-229838241.html]
 # Create new user and group (which contains new user) in LDAP
 # Go to Directories admin panel
 # Click "Synchronise"

*IMPORTANT:* Defect is reproducible only during the first synchronization, after new user and group are added. You need to create new user and group every time you want to reproduce this bug.
h3. Expected Results

Confluence will sync with its LDAP source without error. 
h3. Actual Results

h3. Workaround

This un-serialization error can be safely ignored in this instance, it will not prevent the LDAP sync from working. 
h4. To resolve the error message

Try the following:
 # Restart Confluence (on all nodes) and try the LDAP sync again.
 # If it fails, disable and re-enable the user directory associated with this LDAP sync

If the problem persists after restarting, please proceed as follows:
 # Reduce the sync time to 5 minutes
 # Go to *Logging and Profiling*
 # Add the following class with DEBUG level: {{com.atlassian.crowd.manager}} 
 # Save the changes
 # Wait for the auto-sync time (5 minutes as per step 1)
 # Please generate a support.zip and open a support incident
fields.summary: Could not synchronise transactional cache [com.atlassian.confluence.user.crowd.CachedCrowdUserDao.USER_CACHE]. Attempting flush instead

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Triggering a reindex on the UI after upgrading Confluence results in an OutOfMemory and application unresponsiveness on large instances.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a Confluence instance below 7.9 (tested with 7.4.9)
 # Populate it with a large data set
 # Upgrade to 7.9+ (tested with 7.13)
 # Trigger an index rebuild from the UI

h3. Expected Results

Reindexing finishes without errors.
h3. Actual Results

Node crashes with an out of memory error:
{code:java|title=atlassian-confluence.log}
2021-11-26 23:33:55,980 ERROR [Catalina-utility-1] [atlassian.confluence.plugin.PluginFrameworkContextListener] launchUpgrades Upgrade failed, application will not start: Upgrade task com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.SplitIndexUpgradeTask@22b566d7 failed during the UPGRADE phase due to: Java heap space
com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeException: Upgrade task com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.SplitIndexUpgradeTask@22b566d7 failed during the UPGRADE phase due to: Java heap space
{code}

{code:java}
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: this writer hit an OutOfMemoryError; cannot complete forceMergeDeletes
Exception in thread "Lucene Merge Thread #24" org.apache.lucene.index.MergePolicy$MergeException: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
   java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
   java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
   Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
{code}
You may also see errors like this in the {*}atlassian-confluence-index.log{*}:
{code:java|title=atlassian-confluence-index.log}
NFO [lucene-interactive-reindexing-thread] [internal.index.lucene.LuceneReIndexer] lambda$null$5 full reindex group 17/17 completed for CONTENT_ONLY, 26% complete
INFO [lucene-interactive-reindexing-thread] [internal.index.lucene.LuceneReIndexer] lambda$null$5 full reindex completed for CONTENT_ONLY, 26% complete, start cleaning up files
ERROR [lucene-interactive-reindexing-thread] [internal.index.lucene.LuceneReIndexer] cleanUpIndex unable to force writer to clean-up
 -- referer: http://1.1.1.1:8090/plugins/servlet/rebuildindex | url: /rest/prototype/latest/index/reindex | traceId: 2784176c19e14e59 | userName: admin
java.io.IOException: background merge hit exception: _nuh(4.4):C3668664/9192 into _p44
    at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.forceMergeDeletes(IndexWriter.java:1817)
    at com.atlassian.bonnie.InstrumentedIndexWriter.forceMergeDeletes(InstrumentedIndexWriter.java:99)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.internal.index.lucene.LuceneReIndexer.cleanUpIndex(LuceneReIndexer.java:256)
...
Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
    at org.apache.lucene.codecs.lucene42.Lucene42DocValuesProducer.loadNumeric(Lucene42DocValuesProducer.java:212)
    at org.apache.lucene.codecs.lucene42.Lucene42DocValuesProducer.getNumeric(Lucene42DocValuesProducer.java:174)
    at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentCoreReaders.getNormValues(SegmentCoreReaders.java:301)
    at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentReader.getNormValues(SegmentReader.java:253)
    at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentMerger.mergeNorms(SegmentMerger.java:215)
    at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentMerger.merge(SegmentMerger.java:119)
    at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.mergeMiddle(IndexWriter.java:3772)
    at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.merge(IndexWriter.java:3376)
    at com.atlassian.bonnie.InstrumentedIndexWriter.merge(InstrumentedIndexWriter.java:113)
    at org.apache.lucene.index.ConcurrentMergeScheduler.doMerge(ConcurrentMergeScheduler.java:405)
    at org.apache.lucene.index.ConcurrentMergeScheduler$MergeThread.run(ConcurrentMergeScheduler.java:482)
{code}
h3. Workaround

Rebuilding the index from scratch *manually* does not trigger this problem:
 * Server: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-rebuild-the-content-indexes-from-scratch-833941594.html]
 * Data Center: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-manually-rebuild-content-index-from-scratch-on-confluence-data-center-without-any-downtime-1027124802.html]

Subsequent reindexes from the UI should complete as expected after the rebuild from scratch.
h3. Notes

Inspecting the heap dump, there are thousands of small *org.apache.lucene.codecs.lucene42.Lucene42DocValuesProducer$3* objects. Digging into those, all of them seem to reference *.nvd* files from the change index folder. Checking the size of those files reveals they are huge, reaching GBs of size depending on the data set.

Looks like there is an issue with the logic of *forceMergeDeletes* which leads to those big files being created and loaded in memory after the split index upgrade task. You can also see that the overall index folder size increases significantly after the upgrade and even more after the failed reindex from the ui. Rebuilding from scratch fixes that and index files return to the expected size.

Since a rebuild from scratch is required to avoid this issue, it is a good approach to remove the index files before upgrading so they are rebuilt with the new format.
fields.summary: Confluence reindex results in OutOfMemory after upgrading

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The drop zone area where users can drop files to attach them to the page on the *attachment page* isn't visible in *Firefox 92*, this issue does not occur in older versions of Firefox.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a page
 # Click on "..." menu >> Attachments
 # Check the lower right corner of the screen

h3. Expected Results

Drop zone area with title "Drop Files Here to Attach Them" should be visible
h3. Actual Results

Drop Zone Area isn't visible
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. This issue doesn't occur in older versions of Firefox
fields.summary: Attachments Drop Zone isn't visible in Firefox 92

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inconsistent font family in Japanese between editing and viewing

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Profile
-- language: Japanese
- Browser
-- Firefox(Mac): 90.0.2 (64-bit)
-- Microsoft Edge(Mac): Version 92.0.902.84 (Official build) (x86_64)


h4. Editing

Font used: .SF NS(System Font)

Firefox:
 !confluence-ja-ff-edit-font.png|thumbnail! 

Microsoft Edge:
 !confluence-ja-edge-edit-font.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Viewing

Font used: Hiragino Kaku Gothic Pro(Hiragino Kaku Gothic Pro W3)

Firefox:
 !confluence-ja-ff-view-font.png|thumbnail! 
Microsoft Edge:
 !confluence-ja-edge-view-font.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results

- Same font family in Japanese between editing and viewing

h3. Actual Results

- Inconsistent font family between editing and viewing in Japanese

h3. Workaround

Use custom CSS. See [Styling Fonts in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/styling-fonts-in-confluence-174751968.html]

h3. Note

Confluence 7.3.5 doesn't happen.
fields.summary: Inconsistent font family between editing and viewing in Japanese

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary Office Macros won't load their content when wrapped in a tag . The issue is happening in version 7.13.0 and it's not reproducible in version 7.6.x h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new Page in Confluence. # Add an Office file (excel, word, or ppt). # Add an Office macro to show the file. # Select the macro. # Select the *B* in the editor bar to apply the bold effect. # Save the page. h3. Expected Results The macro should load normally regardless of the strong tag. h3. Actual Results Because of the strong tag created by the bold option the macro will not display its content. I have attached an exported space where we can reproduce the issue. Also, the storage format of a page with the issue is the following: {code:yaml}


{code} h3. Workaround The user can remove the tag by editing the affected page, selecting the macro, and selecting the "bold" option in the edit bar.
fields.summary: Office Macros won't load when wrapped in a tag

fields.description:
h3. Problem

In Confluence in order to display the IDP as the primary login, it is currently necessary to disable auth_fallback.
h3. Suggested Solution

_Allow auth_fallback to be enabled, while still servicing the IDP as the primary login._ 
h3. Why This Is Important

It would be useful to be able to leave this enabled and have the IDP served as the login page, while the fallback address remains available if directly searched for. This feature is currently available in Jira, and the difference in managing this can create issues for admins. 
h3. Workaround

_None identified as of yet._
fields.summary: Allow use of IDP as primary login, while auth_fallback is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a page has the *Table of Content* and *Team Calendars* macro and all of the content on the page has been highlighted to use *Heading 1* style, then the ToC displays extra text for the TC macro.
{quote}Calendars with a related space are easier to find and use. Find out why, and set related spaces. Error(s) occurred. Warning(s) occurred. Calendars with restrictions are embedded here. Today Previous Next Add Event Subscribe EDIT THE CALENDARCustomise the different types of events you'd like to manage in this calendar.NextSkip tour#legIndex/#totalLegsRESTRICT THE CALENDAROptionally, restrict who can view or add events to the team calendar.NextSkip tour#legIndex/#totalLegsSHARE WITH YOUR TEAMGrab the calendar's URL and email it to your team, or paste it on a page to embed the calendar.NextSkip tour#legIndex/#totalLegsADD AN EVENTThe calendar is ready to go! Click any day on the calendar to add an event or use the Add event button.NextSkip tour#legIndex/#totalLegsSUBSCRIBESubscribe to calendars using your favourite calendar client.Done#legIndex/#totalLegs
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page.
 # Insert a ToC macro.
 # Insert a Team Calendar macro.
 # Highlight everything on the page and change its styling from Paragraph to Heading 1.
 # Save the page.

h3. Expected Results

The ToC macro should only display any text on that page using the Heading 1 styling.
h3. Actual Results

The ToC macro also displays extra text in place of the Team Calendars macro.
 !ToC Macro.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Ensure the Team Calendar macro is not highlighted using Heading 1 formatting and that it uses paragraph.
fields.summary: When a Team Calendars macro is highlighted as Heading 1, extra text appears for the calendar in the ToC macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The Confluence Analytics Gui, introduced in Confluence 7.12, displays the number of views an attachment has. 
But unlike the page views feature, it does not show which users viewed the attachments. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Include an feature that shows which users viewed the attachments. 

h3. Workaround

All the required data is stored in the table "AO_7B47A5_EVENT", and can be extracted there.
Run the query below to see who viewed the attachments

{noformat}
select c.title,to_timestamp(cast ("EVENT_AT" as bigint)/ 1000) , "NAME", "SPACE_KEY", um.username  from "AO_7B47A5_EVENT" e, content c, user_mapping um where e."USER_KEY" = um.user_key  and  e."CONTENT_ID" = c.contentid and e."NAME" = 'attachment_viewed';
{noformat}
fields.summary: Ability to see which users viewed the attachments in Confluence Analytics

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user opens the keyboard shortcuts using the "?" shortcut, accessibility screen readers (like NVDA) show a blank screen

The following links have been helpful for some users - they're able to use wiki markup and keyboard shortcuts as a workaround. However, the issue is that this information is not available inside the the editor:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-wiki-markup-251003035.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/keyboard-shortcuts-139456.html

This information needs to be available inside the editor to work properly with screen readers.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install NVDA
 # On a Confluence page, press '?' and try to navigate the shortcuts

h3. Expected Results

Keyboard shortcuts screen should have navigation available for screen readers
h3. Actual Results

Navigation is not possible with NVDA, only a blank screen.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When a user opens the keyboard shortcuts, accessibility screen readers show a blank screen

fields.description:
In Comala [Document Management v6.16.4|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/142/comala-workflows?tab=versions&hosting=server] we released the workaround recommended by you on https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52489. That worked properly in Confluence 7.13.0. However now testing Confluence 7.14.0-beta1 we have discovered that our app's [JSON Content Properties|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/content-properties-in-the-rest-api/] are not indexed (we checked them to be properly stored) neither after creation nor after running a full instance reindex.

This is a critical issue as it affects a main functionality of our app and would not allow it to be compatible with this new Confluence version.

Here are the steps you can follow to reproduce the issue:
 # Create a new space
 # Add the "Simple Approval Workflow" to the space
 # Create a new page in that space
 # Assign the approval in the page to your current user
 # Go to the "Confluence Dashboard" or the user profile's "Document Actions" section
 # Check that the approval you just assigned to yourself appears there (it doesn't and it should)

 

Thing is we have done further tests and we observed the following:
 * If we use Comala Document Management v6.16.3 (which does not include the workaround explained in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52489 ) in Confluence 7.14 then the behaviour is the expected one (step 6 above shows the approval) but if you perform a full instance reindex you loose the data as it is explained in CONFSERVER-52489 when not using the workaround
 * To ensure this has nothing to do with any of our other changes in v6.16.4 we have test it with a version of it which only difference is the removal of the workaround applied for CONFSERVER-52489 and it works exactly as v6.16.3 did.
fields.summary: Confluence 7.14-beta1 app's JSON Content Properties are not indexed

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When Livesearch is configured in the space sidebar, the search results are overlapped and are difficult to read
h3. Environment

Confluence 7.13.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a test space, [configure the sidebar to add a search field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configure-the-sidebar-317194694.html#ConfiguretheSidebar-Addingcustomcontenttoasidebar]
 ## Navigate to *Space Tools* > *Look and Feel* > *Sidebar, header and footer*
 ## Inside the Sidebar box, type- {livesearch}
 ## Save
 # You should now see the search box in the sidebar
 # Try searching for some texts

h3. Expected Results

_The result pages are rendered readable without overlapping texts_
h3. Actual Results

_The result texts are overlapped_
h3. Workaround

_If you highlight the results one by one, you can then see the page names correctly_
fields.summary: Search result texts overlap when Livesearch configured in the sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Problem

XStream is vulnerable to security exploits such as highlighted in the image attached.
 (i) The list of CVEs can be found in [https://x-stream.github.io/security.html]

This ticket tracks its upgrade to 1.4.18.
h3. Environment

Confluence v7.13
h3. Workaround

Set {{xstream.allowlist.enable}} sysprop to true. This is equivalent to XStream 1.4.18 behaviour and it exist in Confluence 7.10 and up. But it comes with a risk of broken third-party plugins which have not yet configured [xstream-security|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/xstream-1-4-upgrade-1026045605.html] module with their classes. Confirm with Third-party plugin vendors before toggling it if your Confluence instance uses a third-party plugin and it relies on XStream.
fields.summary: XStream upgrade to 1.4.18

_N/A_

h3. Notes
This issue can not be replicated always and for this large page, it took me 5 tries before I managed to replicate it. What is noticed is that the more changes across the page we have before the update the better the chances for the issue. Refreshing the original big page while running updates helps aswell. If we repeat the request few more times with the same request, eventually the page will update.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using REST API to update large pages after restart of Collaborative editing will throw 501 error.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The Jira Issue collection cannot be embedded on a Confluence Page using the HTML Macro.
h3. Environment
* Tested on Confluence *7.13.0* with Jira running *8.16.1* for the *Jira Issue Collector*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* *On the Jira side*
** Create a new Project
** Go to *Project > Settings* and *create a new Jira Issue collector*
** Copy/Paste the output code as per image attached
* *On the Confluence side* 
** Make sure to enable HTML Macro from !https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/files/790796813/947856965/1/1522298459209/cog-new.png|width=17,height=17! > Manage apps > System Plugins
** Create a new Confluence page and add an HTML Macro onto it. 
** Copy the code coming from the Jira issue collector and save/publish the page.
 
h3. Expected Results
* The Jira issue collector feedback button should be rendered properly with the HTML Macro (/)

h3. Actual Results
* Nothing is rendered from the HTML Macro (x). Interestingly, while in preview mode the HTML content is shown.

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Unable to Render JIRA Issue Collector when embedded via HTML/Javascript on Confluence Page

fields.description:
When the site is exported, it would generate a large XML file that contains all the Confluence data including all audit records.

An option (just a checkbox) to exclude all audit records would:
 # Decrease the size of the generated backup file
 # Make XML export and import faster
 # Decrease memory consumption on import
fields.summary: Add an option to skip audit records when the site is being exported

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira Macro does not display custom field values when a "+" is used in the custom field name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Jira, add a custom field to a project and include a "+" in the custom field name.
 ## Add some values to the custom field within the project and save. 
 # Add the Jira macro to a Confluence page. 
 ## In the display options, add the new custom field and save. 

h3. Expected Results

The custom field and its values should appear in the Jira macro.
h3. Actual Results

The custom field appears in the Jira macro, but the values are not displayed.
h3. Workaround

Remove the "+" symbol from the custom field name in Jira, and the values will be displayed within the Jira macro in Confluence.
fields.summary: Jira Macro does not display custom field values when a "+" is used in the custom field name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence currently has an incorrect behaviour of  allowing a user to be added in Page restriction of a child page when he does not have permission to parent page or Space.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page tree having structure like below
 ## Page 1
 ### Page 1.1
 # Add the users a,b,c to Page 1 Page restrictions
 # Go to page Page 1.1 and open Page restrictions and add user d in view and edit restrictions

h3. Expected Results

User d should not be allowed to be added in child page as it does not have parent page access. There should be a permission check in Confluence which should check when a user is added in child pages.
h3. Actual Results

User d is allowed to be added in page 1.1 in view and edit restriction. However, contradictory to this, when user tries to access page 1.1, he gets a restricted page warning.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect behaviour of Confluence to allow a user to be added in Page restriction of a child page when he does not have permission to parent page or Space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It is possible to write log entries via Synchrony API without authentication.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 To do this, you have to enter the target URL in Postman:<base URL>, copy the GET or POST request and send the http request.
For all POST requests, you must ensure that the content length matches (e.g. if the POST body has 231 characters, the content length must also be 231). I have marked in orange what to look out for in the individual inquiries.
Send the following http POST request to the web server:

{noformat}
POST /synchrony/v1/errorlog HTTP/1.1
Host: <baseURL>
Content-Length: 206
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/90.0.4430.93 Safari/537.36
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: /
Origin: <baseURL>
Referer: <baseURL>/pages/resumedraft.action?draftId=22839529&draftShareId=8ed7dcf2-8b7e-41c4-aa0b-a8511dad37fb&
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept-Language: de-DE,de;q=0.9,en-US;q=0.8,en;q=0.7
Connection: close

{"clientId":"IJjq9O5FeRuZWfZ60tthnzs", "entityId":"/Synchrony-1274ffbb-8ef2-3131-b438-d2b6304af43f/confluence-22839528", "message":"test error message", "source":"client", "oo":"test_error", "clientId":"test"}{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Nothing is displayed in logs with when an unauthenticated user sends a request.

h3. Actual Results
User can write to the log.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sending an unauthenticated request to the Synchrony allows writing to the logs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When user try to search content from the top right search bar with only the "Any Time" condition, it does not work and only show the recently viewed page.
PS: The "Any Time" condition will work if other condition is selected or search term is entered

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click the search bar at top right
# Notice the result show recently viewed pages
# Click "Any Time" in the Date field
# Notice the search result does not change at all
For details, please refer to following video
 [^Recording #8.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
Shows all pages that created in Confluence as the "Any Time" option should return any pages created at any time

h3. Actual Results
It does not work and only show recently viewed page

h3. Workaround
Make sure other condition or search term is entered before using the "Any Time" condition
fields.summary: Search filter "Any Time" in Date option does not work alone

fields.description:
*Current result:*

The sidebar is not defined as a landmark. 

*Expected result:*

The sidebar should be defined as a landmark. [https://aui.atlassian.com/aui/latest/docs/page.html] 

AUI recommends using aria-label="sidebar" with proper translations

To discuss with BB if we should use role="complementary"

*Scope:*

This should be checked on all key screens in Confluence.

e.g. (check for more)
 * space / view page 
 * dashboard
 * user profile
 * admin
 * space directory

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Preview of shared drafts (from Collaborative editing) in non Collaborative editing mode will render the page in a popup window without DrawIO diagrams.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a draft in Collaborative editing and add DrawIO diagram. Add title eg. "123"
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-06 at 17.14.23.png|thumbnail! 
 # Set Collaborative editing to OFF
 # In order to recover shared drafts open Drafts under the menu.
 # Click view on our 123 draft

h3. Expected Results
The page is rendered with all addons images and macros.

h3. Actual Results
The page is rendered without a Draw io diagram.
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-06 at 17.15.13.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
Contact support to recover the draft storage format and then recreate the page from it.
fields.summary: Preview of shared drafts in non Collaborative editing mode will render page without DrawIO diagrams.

fields.description:
Please implement globally configurable TTL for drafts.
Year by year our Confluence instance collects a pile of abandoned drafts created by former users. These drafts with attachments take lots of storage space but can't be effectively managed by systems administrators.
It would be great if Confluence automatically removed such an unpublished draft content after some configurable number of days.
fields.summary: TTL for draft content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The next export date does not update even after the first scheduled job is completed in the Data pipeline schedule screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Schedule Data pipeline export to trigger after 1 min
 # Navigate to the Data pipeline schedule main screen after 1 min and check the next export scheduled date.

h3. Expected Results

The next export date should be updated to the next schedule.
h3. Actual Results

The next export date does not change. Same as the first scheduled date in the past.
h3. Workaround

No workaround. Although UI displays incorrect date, export job runs correctly as initially scheduled.
fields.summary: "Next Export Date" in Data Pipeline displays timestamps in the past after first export
Improve Confluence user macro language to not override external link CSS classes.

h3. Summary
When a user is mentioned in a comment, Confluence will then show the user's full/display name. However, in _All updates_ tab, we use username directly to represent mentioned user. See screenshot.
 !comment.png|thumbnail!  !dashboard.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a page, add a comment, in comment, mention a user. 
 # Go to Confluence Dashboard, click on "All updates" tab, notice the mentioned user is pure username text. 

h3. Expected Results
Confluence to display user's full/display name in the _All updates_ tab.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence displayed user's username in the _All updates_ tab.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

UPM styles need some updates.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click gear icon on navigation bar
 # Go to "manage apps"

h3. Expected Results

It should look good

!image-2021-09-21-11-29-10-986.png|width=421,height=177!
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-09-03-16-07-57-452.png|width=350,height=277!
h3. Workaround

Confirmed that Confluence "User-installed" dropdown issue is caused by "confluence search prototype" Chrome Extension.

[https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/confluence-search-prototy/ifkfconngdaokkjggiidleekoicbaknc]

This extension was a experiment for collecting feedback for the new search panel design on community portal.

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-discussions/Try-the-new-Confluence-Server-Search-on-your-site/td-p/753815]

h3. Problem

Looking for a facility similar to Jira Issue macro where users can display a single issue, a list of issues, or a count on a confluence page with the help of JQL search, filter or URL. At this moment there are issues to create a two-way link between Jira Cloud and On-premises Confluence server due to network restrictions and one-way link provides only publicly accessible view hence looking for an auth token or other suitable mechanism on Confluence side for achieving this. And expectation is to not do any configuration changes on the Jira cloud even users being admin on both the sides. 
h3. Suggested Solution

A possible Jira macros on the Confluence side to be able to access the Cloud instance without a need to set anything up on the Jira Cloud instance.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Failed login attempt from anonymous users can trigger captcha for all users.

h3. Environment

Confluence v7.13

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Attempt to login to Confluence via the following endpoint multiple times; Usually 3, which is the default limit before captcha is triggered.
{code}
curl -X POST \
-H 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
-d 'os_username=&os_password=test&login=Log+in&os_destination=' \
'<Confluence_Base_URL>/dologin.action'
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The login will fail, although, the login page for all other users in Confluence shouldn't be impacted. 

h3. Actual Results

A captcha is seen for any login page in Confluence. All users in Confluence will have to enter captcha to login.

h3. Workaround

There are a couple of workarounds for this,
* Restart Confluence 
* Flush cache for logins
** *General Configuration* > *Cache Management* > *Login Manager - Login attempts for unknown users* > Flush
fields.summary: Failed login attempts from an anonymous user can trigger captcha for all users

!replicate locally.png|width=443,height=220!

h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.summary: Word documents using the Courier Font appear blank in the File Preview when Confluence OS is Windows.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

With recently introduced changes in Confluence *7.11 and above* version,
 it is not possible to export the Confluence Microsoft SQL Server database to a .BACPAC format to restore elsewhere, whereas it was previously possible to do so.

Steps to reproduce:
 * Install Confluence version 7.11+ configured with a Microsoft SQL Server Database server version 2017
 * Access the Confluence Database from for instance from *SQL Server Management Studio*:
 *Right-click on the Confluence database* *-> Tasks -> Export Data-tier application*
 ** Such an export was working *prior* to version 7.11 for Confluence (/)
 ** Such an export stopped working for Confluence version 7.11+ (x), Such errors will occur in the Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio logs:
{code:java}
One or more unsupported elements were found in the schema used as part of a data package.
Error SQL71561: Error validating element [dbo].[denormalised_content_trigger]: Trigger: [dbo].[denormalised_content_trigger] has an unresolved reference to object [ConfluenceDBName].[dbo].[CONTENT]. External references are not supported when creating a package from this platform.
Error SQL71562: Error validating element [dbo].[denormalised_content_trigger]: Trigger: [dbo].[denormalised_content_trigger] has an unresolved reference to object [ConfluenceDBName].[dbo].[CONTENT].[CONTENTID]. External references are not supported when creating a package from this platform.
Error SQL71562: Error validating element [dbo].[denormalised_content_trigger]: Trigger: [dbo].[denormalised_content_trigger] has an unresolved reference to object [ConfluenceDBName].[dbo].[CONTENT].[CONTENTTYPE]. External references are not supported when creating a package from this platform.
Error SQL71562: Error validating element [dbo].[denormalised_content_trigger]: Trigger: [dbo].[denormalised_content_trigger] has an unresolved reference to object [ConfluenceDBName].[dbo].[CONTENT].[PREVVER]. External references are not supported when creating a package from this platform.
[...]
{code}

Since the recent changes introduced in Confluence 7.11 with some Denormalised triggers, The BACPAC export feature has stopped functioning for the Confluence DB as they are some explicit references to the DB name (and potentially other causes as well).
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Support the BACPAC export for Confluence Microsoft SQL Server Database

h3. Why This Is Important

This third-party export to BACPAC can be important to be able to get a backup of the Confluence database to work on in a different environment or to move to Azure SQL.
h3. Workaround

Perform a full database backup (.BAK file extension) and restore following Microsoft SQL Server Database official documentation offers a viable way to backup and restore Confluence MSSQL Database at the present time.

(i) It is also possible to perform a *.BAK* to *.BACPAC* conversion using online documentation toolings
fields.summary: Ability to export a Confluence Database to a .BACPAC format using export Data-Tier Application for Microsoft SQL Server Database

fields.description:
{panel:title=Note|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6554c0|titleBGColor=#6554c0|bgColor=#eae6ff|titleColor=#ffffff}
*This bug fix is currently being backported to Confluence 7.4.x and 7.13.x LTS releases.*

{color:red}*We have confirmed that plugins that interact with attachments during the process of saving or creating pages can also trigger this issue. This behaviour significantly expands the impact of the issue as it is not apparent to the user that a plugin is interacting with attachments in the background. We believe this accounts for a significant number of continuing duplication reports.*{color}

For more information about this and related content duplication issues, please see the discussion at [Confluence Server and Data Center: Content duplication fix and next steps \- Atlassian Community|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-discussions/Confluence-Server-and-Data-Center-Content-duplication-fix-and/m-p/1873941#M9241].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary
When editing a page, the page content, or a subset of the page content is duplicated. The behaviour occurs after an attachment is edited on the page and the page published or saved rapidly thereafter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
The behaviour can be replicated with the below steps. These steps will reliably reproduce the issue, but are not he only way the issue presents. We *DO NOT* recommend taking these steps outside of testing environments

h4. Example 1
# Create a page with text and at least one attachment like an image
# Publish the page
# Perform a [hard data eviction in Synchrony|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-remove-synchrony-data-968658367.html#HowtoremoveSynchronydata-hardremove] (this step is used to reliably reproduce the issue as a proxy of other internal operations)
# Navigate to the attachments list on the page created in Step 1
# Edit an existing attachment, or upload a new attachment
# Return to the page and edit it
# The content appears duplicated

h4. Example 2
# Create a page (page A) with text
# Publish page A
# Create a new page (page B) with text, and paste a link to page A to create a mention
# Publish page B
# Perform a [hard data eviction in Synchrony|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-remove-synchrony-data-968658367.html#HowtoremoveSynchronydata-hardremove] (this step is used to reliably reproduce the issue as a proxy of other internal operations)
# Navigate to page A and either upload a new attachment, or modify an existing one
# Return to page A and edit it
# The content of page A appears duplicated
# Navigate to page B and edit it
# The content of page B appears duplicated without having interacted directly with the page

h3. Expected Results
The editor should only display the page content without duplication.

h3. Actual Results
The content appears to be duplicated in edit mode, and publishing the page results in the duplicated content being visible in view mode.

h3. Workaround
# In the Editor, click the Ellipsis ({{...}}) symbol
# Click {{Revert to last published version}}
fields.summary: Duplicate Content Shown When Editing A Page After Modifying An Attachment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After performing a site or space import, the TinyURLs are not updated and therefore are still pointing to the source destination.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use TinyURL in your pages
 # Generate a backup of Confluence.
 # Import it to a new instance.
 # Check the pages which display TinyURL.

h3. Expected Results

The TinyURL is updated correctly after import.
h3. Actual Results

The TinyURL stays the same and cannot be used as it points to the original location.
h3. Workaround

The only way to fix these TinyURL is to manually go through each one and change it to the correct TinyURL displayed in the *Page information*.
fields.summary: TinyURL are not updated after import to another instance

h3. Suggestion summary
 * Confluence might handle error in a better way than displaying the stack trace.

h3. Description:
 * Customer is concerned about the detailed error which Confluence displays in GUI, Customer is appending a "|" character at the end of the URL and it breaks, when it breaks it provides Java stack trace and includes the Apache Tomcat version being used. Customer fears that a middle man can use these data and can exploit.
{quote}
https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-294034
{quote}

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 * Take any random Confluence URL and add a "|" character at the end of the URL

h3. Actual behaviour:

h3. Expected behaviour:
 * Confluence should display an error message as "Page not found"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary On MySQL database, if the JDBC driver version 8.0.26 is used, then export of the site to XML will produce corrupted and unimportable archive. This issue is caused by the [bug|https://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=104641] in MySQL JDBC Driver. It's reproducible now only on version 8.0.26 (and possibly later releases until the bug is fixed). The bug can also affect Cloud Migrations, because the produced export file is corrupted. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Provision 1-node DC with MySQL database using JDBC Driver 8.0.26 # Go through all setup steps (choose empty site, create a space and the page in the end) # Perform the site export to ZIP archive # Perform site import of the same archive The problem happens during site export. It generates duplicated FK in the XML file, which is predictably fails during the import. {code:none}
{code} Because the problem is originated in the MySQL driver and is not caused by Confluence, I've also created a unit test that reproduces the problem: https://github.com/badgersow/mysql-duplicate-fk-bug h3. Expected Results The import finishes successfully h3. Actual Results Import throws an exception (see screenshot and the stack trace). !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! {noformat} Caused by: java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: Table 'confluence.AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION' doesn't exist at com.mysql.cj.jdbc.exceptions.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:120) at com.mysql.cj.jdbc.exceptions.SQLExceptionsMapping.translateException(SQLExceptionsMapping.java:122) at com.mysql.cj.jdbc.ClientPreparedStatement.executeInternal(ClientPreparedStatement.java:953) at com.mysql.cj.jdbc.ClientPreparedStatement.executeQuery(ClientPreparedStatement.java:1003) at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyPreparedStatement.executeQuery(NewProxyPreparedStatement.java:1471) at net.java.ao.ForwardingPreparedStatement.executeQuery(ForwardingPreparedStatement.java:40) at net.java.ao.ParameterMetadataCachingPreparedStatement.executeQuery(ParameterMetadataCachingPreparedStatement.java:10) at net.java.ao.EntityManager.stream(EntityManager.java:889) at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.stream(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:174) ... 475 more {noformat} h3. Workaround If the duplicated FK lines are removed manually from the xml file prior to import, the import will work. The bug manifests itself by producing multiple identical FK definitions.
fields.summary: Site export/import fails on MySQL database with JDBC Driver 8.0.26

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When trying to preview a PDF attachment in Browser, some of the pages does not render and are showing blank. Downloading the PDF or having then embedded in the PDF Macro will show complete Content.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Download a PDF with many pages, and attach it to a Confluence page. (Used Confluence 6.2 Guide PDF)

Go to the attachments Page and try to preview the file
h3. Expected Results

_We Should be able to view all the pages without issue. Showing page 12 as it's the one not rendering._

!image-2021-08-26-19-16-18-813.png|width=556,height=313!
h3. Actual Results

The PDF does not render correctly and is blank in the preview

_!image-2021-08-26-19-15-36-226.png|width=556,height=313!_
h3. Workaround

_Adding the PDF to a page inside a PDF Macro, will render it correcly_

_!image-2021-08-26-19-19-36-800.png|width=556,height=313!_
h3. Notes

I have tested this with Several Browsers, so it seems something changed in newer versions?

Vival 4+ -> Works OK

Firefox 88+ -> Doesn't work, I didn't test 87 and previews

Chrome 92 -> Doesn't Work

Edge 91+ -> Doesn't Work, I couldn't test previous version

Safari 14+ -> Works OK

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Endpoint "*rest/config/1.0/directory*" can be accessed anonymously. This page is an XML output that exposes the gadgets installed on the Confluence instance.

While there are not be any identifying information, user data, or anything else available to anonymous users if they hit this URL, a potential bad actor could better understand which add-ons customers have installed into their Confluence instance and use that information to their advantage to attack them. This could be through malicious attacks that exploit those add-ons specifically, taking advantage of possible security vulnerabilities of those instances, or phishing-like attacks where the bad actor may impersonate vendors to get information from us.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Access <Confluence BASE URL>/rest/config/1.0/directory anonymously
h3. Expected Results

The user gets redirected to log in

h3. Actual Results

The page is shown:
 !local.png|thumbnail! 

 

*Notes*
 This happens even if the public access is blocked using a flag in the dark features

This page is used by the *Confluence gadget plugin* so we don't recommend blocking it as it might cause some functionalities to fail in Confluence, and this was not tested.

 
h3. Workaround

Block the unauthenticated access to this particular URL **/rest/config/1.0/directory* at the network level. For example, block the URL from being accessed from the proxy side. Another option is doing it from Apache Tomcat: [How to block access to a specific URL at Tomcat|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-block-access-to-a-specific-url-at-tomcat-966668691.html]
fields.summary: Anonymous users can view list of installed gadgets in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When attaching the Jira issue collector to newer versions of Confluence, the top menu bar overlaps the Jira widget that becomes invisible on the page.
 You can see the widget again if you can scroll the page down or if the administrator access banner is present on top of the page.
h3. Environment

Newer versions of Confluence (7.12 and 7.13). 
 Version 7.4.9 is not affected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a [Jira issue collector|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/use-the-issue-collector/] with the Prominent style and copy the snippet to embed it on other sites.
 # Add it to Confluence:

 * Go to  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/747833194/747833195/2/1517274813281/cog.png|width=16!  > *General Configuration* > *Custom HTML*.
 * Click *edit* and add the snippet at the "At end of the BODY" section.
 * Save

h3. Expected Results

The Jira issue collector will be visible all the time.
 !image-2021-08-24-16-30-03-434.png|width=327,height=131!
h3. Actual Results

The Jira issue collector is hidden behind the Confluence top menu bar
!image-2021-08-24-16-36-08-319.png|width=327,height=131!
!image-2021-08-24-16-36-23-709.png|width=327,height=131!
!image-2021-08-24-16-36-38-630.png|width=327,height=131!
  
h3. Workaround

As this bug is only reproducible with the Prominent style, if you choose any other style you will not be affected.
 It is possible to edit the Global Stylesheet to give higher priority to this widget over the top menu bar.
 # Go to  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/747833194/747833195/2/1517274813281/cog.png|width=16!  > *General Configuration* > *Stylesheet*
 # Click edit
 # Add the following
{code:java}
.atlwdg-trigger.atlwdg-TOP {
z-index: 100 !important;
position:fixed;
}{code}
# Save

(on) Please note that the custom global stylesheet will not be applied to spaces that define their own custom stylesheet or are using a theme.
 (i) This workaround will fix the snippets on all spaces but not on the Global Configuration screen.
h3. Notes
fields.summary: Confluence top menu bar overlaps Jira issue collector when using Prominent style

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When multiple users are adding comments to the same Confluence page, they are all notified of others' new inline comments in floating boxes that appear at the top right. Each of these boxes includes a "Show" link for viewing the new comment, but sometimes those links instead have text like "Reload Page" and clicking on them does just that, losing information about all other new comments since the previous page load.
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Install Confluence.
 # Create three different users in Confluence with edit access to the same page.
 # Create a page with some text like "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit".
 # Access that page with the three users at the same time and perform the following:
 ## With User A: highlight "ipsum dolor" and add an inline comment.
 ## At approximately the same time make User B highlights "dolor sit amet" and add another an inline comment.
 ## Check the notifications from User C.

h3. Actual Result

User C sees "New inline comment" notifications for the comments from substeps 4.1 and 4.2, the first of which includes a "Show" link and the second of which instead includes a "Reload Page" link.
 After selecting the "Reload page" option the page is reloaded but all other notifications regarding the inline comments are cleared
h3. Desired Result

The user should be able to track all inline comments that are being performed through the notification menu with a show link option and not only the first one.
 Also, the user should be able to choose when to clear those messages so he may have an option to track down the inline comments that are being created on the page.
fields.summary: Improve the Reload page to see new comment option

fields.description:

{noformat}
+----------------+----------------------+
| database_name  | table_name           |
+----------------+----------------------+
| confluence_dev | hibernate_unique_key |
| confluence_dev | MIG_DB_CHANGELOG     |
| confluence_dev | storageenginetest    |
+----------------+----------------------+
{noformat}
fields.summary: InnoDB cluster support

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary Create or update a page with Jira Issue Macro by using REST API or SOAP API call will result in missing "mentioned in" link on the Jira side. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create or update the page with REST API. Use storage format that has correct values for Jira issue macro: {code}

JIRAissuekey,summary,issuetype,created,updated,duedate,assignee,reporter,priority,status,resolutionkey,summary,type,created,updated,due,assignee,reporter,priority,status,resolutionde8309d4-ca60-3cfe-93b3-af7d2b541ebeTEST-50

{code} # Check on Jira side if the "mentioned in" link is created. h3. Expected Results Link is created. h3. Actual Results Link is not created. h3. Workaround Execute another REST API call on the Jira side to update the links. - We need a POST request to /rest/api/latest/issue//remotelink In my case "jira_issue_id" was TEST-65. - Payload or body needs to have this: {code} { "application": { "name": "Confluence", "type": "com.atlassian.confluence" }, "globalId": "appId=1bfdce92-4913-368a-bf61-6f8ecc5ecb5b&pageId=2621447", "relationship": "mentioned in", "object": { "title": "Page", "url": "http://localhost:27122/c7122/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2621447" } } {code} -- The "1bfdce92-4913-368a-bf61-6f8ecc5ecb5b" is the application link id, that can be retrieved from the URL of the edit page of that application link in Jira. !Screen Shot 2021-08-23 at 16.57.39.png|thumbnail! -- We have [Confluence pageid|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-get-confluence-page-id-648380445.html] in 2 places with 2621447 -- And lastly, we have a Confluence link with "http://localhost:27122/c7122/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=". This request should create a "mentioned in" link to the correct Confluence page after we have updated the Confluence page with JIM.
fields.summary: Create or update a page with Jira Issue Macro by using REST API or SOAP API call will result in missing "mentioned in" link on the Jira side.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Expand macro, the links for each of the collapsed content section are hidden from the keyboard tab order. For those who may not use a mouse to navigate a website or application, using the tab key is essential. When using the tab key the tab focus skips over the Expand links and all the collapsed content is hidden and blocking keyboard-only users and assistive technology users from the content.

Currently, once the content is expanded the text is readable by a screen reader. But the intention of expandable content is the ability to choose to expand or collapse content. Any collapsed content should be ignored by a screen reader until expanded. A future state for this would be to have each of the expandable links in the keyboard tab order. When a screen reader user focuses on each link, the screen reader should say what state the content is in "expanded" or "collapsed." When the links are activated using the enter key, the screen reader should announce the new state "expanded" or "collapsed." When expanded, and the content appears visually the screen reader user should be able to navigate directly into the newly visible content. The page should not refresh or push the focus to another part of the page. The keyboard focus should remain on the activated link until the person chooses to navigate into the content or elsewhere on the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Just use JAWS screen reader or NVDA screen reader.

h3. Expected Behaviour.
The focus of the tab key should be able to access the Expanded content 

h3. Actual Behaviour
When using the tab key the tab focus skips over the Expand links and all the collapsed content is hidden and blocking keyboard-only users and assistive technology users from the content.
fields.summary: Make expandable content accessible thought keyboard only.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The user macro using the "Rendered" option uses a pretty simplistic code while just referencing the "$body" variable in order to pass the user's input trough.

Unfortunately, if an user enters a headline first, the headline will be ignored, hence, it does not show up on the Confluence page.
h3. Environment

Confluence 7.12.2

Confluence 7.4.6
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a simple  user macro using he "Rendered" option as below: 
  !image-2021-08-20-19-58-43-344.png|width=420,height=775!
 #  Use this macro in a Confluence Page.
 #  In the first line use heading followed by regular text. 
!image-2021-08-20-20-02-04-078.png|width=434,height=287!
 # Save the page.

h3. Expected Results

_It should render the heading text._ 
h3. Actual Results

_It does not render the heading text._

_!image-2021-08-20-20-04-15-177.png|width=158,height=103!_
h3. Workaround

If we enters an empty line at the end of his input, the headline appears.
 * !image-2021-08-20-20-05-23-178.png|width=244,height=214!
 * !image-2021-08-20-20-06-04-785.png|width=223,height=177!

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Heading text not rendering in the User Macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem

For pages in Confluence that have Page Properties macro, if any column's name is _linked_ to a page within the Confluence site, the value for this column will not display in Page Properties Report macro if this column is under the "Columns to Display" option
h3. Environment

Confluence 7.12
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create some pages with Page Properties macro and insert a table with columns and rows inside the macro.
 # Add a link for any one of the column names. The link should be added by choosing the *_Search_* option and search for a page within the site.
 # Create a new page and add the Page Properties Report macro to display these pages
 # Edit the Page Properties Report macro and under the "Columns to Display" option, choose the column name that you have _hyperlinked_
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

You should see the column values in the Page Properties Report
h3. Actual Results

The values for this column do not display.
h3. Workaround
 * The behavior only exists if the column name is linked to a page using the _Search_ field. If you use the *_Web Link_* of the page, this behavior is not seen.
 * The column values are displayed as expected if the "Columns To Display" filter is not used.

h3. Notes
 * This behavior was not present in 6.12.X.
fields.summary: A column's values in Page Properties macro will not display if the column is hyperlinked to a page within Confluence and Columns to Display filter is used

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching an exact match for a *single phrase* within *double quotation* does not works at all times, meaning to say stemming is not ignored. The issue is intermittent and more work to find the exact word while there is a huge data for Confluence.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a few pages having words like painted , paint , paint abc, edit, Jenkins etc.
 # Now search for a word with exact match as below -
 ** "painted"
 ** "edited"
 # Also search for an exact match for "Jenkin"

h3. Expected Results
 # Its observed that the word *paint* is being highlighted as well even though the search was performed for an exact match of *painted*.
 # The same issue is reproducible while searched with word paint - *paint*
 # The search picks up *Jenkins* while we tried to search for an exact match for *Jenkin*
 # All screenshots are attached

h3. Actual Results
 # Searching for an exact match for the words painted, Jenkin should display and highlight these specific words if its present in Confluence and if not then search results should not display anything.
 # There can be many more words like this hence the login for an exact match has to be specific.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Searching an exact match for a single phrase within double quotation does not works at all times

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When adding the [Table of Contents|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-contents-macro-182682099.html] (TOC) macro to a page, the same will list all the headings from the page, as expected, but now it is also displaying headings added to comments to the same page:
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-17 at 19.12.22.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

Confluence 7.12.3, 7.12.4, and 7.13.0.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# # Create a Confluence page.
# In the page editor, add a [Table of Contents|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-contents-macro-182682099.html] (TOC) macro. The macro doesn't require any specific configuration.
# Add some headings to the body of the page.
# Save the page. You will see the macro listing the headings.
# Add a comment that contains any heading and refresh the page.
# You will see the macro listing the headings from the page body *and* the headings from the comment section

h3. Expected Results

On Confluence 7.12.2 and lower versions, the macro only lists the headings added to the page body.

h3. Workaround

Remove the headings from the comments of pages that contain the TOC macro.
fields.summary: Table of Contents (TOC) macro displays headings from the comment section

fields.description:
We have a page with hundreds of very large attachments. Today, a user tried to 'Download All' and crashed the server. Since Confluence knows the file size of every attachment listed in the plugin, it should add them and check that value against the space in the temp folder (doubling to account for the fact that Confluence does not build the zip in place). Note that individual downloads are not an issue, because they do not get zipped in the temp folder.

 

PS: A secondary alternative is to add an option in the macro to disable (or even hide) the Download All link.
fields.summary: Attachment macro should check system space first

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a recurring event with an "end repeat date", the event created in the database not formatted properly. This leads to errors like this in the {{atlassian-confluence.log}}:
{code:java}
2021-08-17 11:08:15,856 ERROR [http-nio-6749-exec-9] [extra.calendar3.model.SubCalendarEvent] toJson Unable to create a JSON object based on this object
 -- referer: http://localhost:6749/c749/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /c749/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | traceId: de95e552e811c387 | userName: admin
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid format: "20211231" is too short
{code}
Based on the below test, Team Calendars versions that are above the 7.0.14 (bundled version) are affected by this
{panel}
 * Confluence DC 7.4.9 + installed TC 7.0.17 (x) reproduced
 * Confluence DC 7.4.10 + installed TC 7.0.17 (x) reproduced
 * Confluence DC 7.11.3 + bundled TC 7.0.14 (/) not reproduced
 * Confluence DC 7.11.3 + upgraded to TC 7.0.17 (x) reproduced
 * Confluence DC 7.12.0 + bundled TC 7.0.14 (/) not reproduced
 * Confluence DC 7.12.1 + bundled TC 7.1.4 (x) reproduced
 * Confluence DC 7.13.0 + bundled TC 7.1.4 (x) reproduced{panel}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence 7.4.9 and apply a DC license
 # Install [Team Calendars 7.0.17|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/apps/72307/version/2060990570] manually.
 # Create a calendar
 # Create a recurring event like this:
 !recurring-event-1.jpg|thumbnail! 
 # Save the event

When you check the *{{RECURRENCE_RULE}}* field for this event in the database:
h3. Expected Results
{code:java}
RECURRENCE_RULE|FREQ=WEEKLY;UNTIL=20211231T230000Z;INTERVAL=1;BYDAY=TH
{code}
h3. Actual Results
{code:java}
RECURRENCE_RULE|FREQ=WEEKLY;UNTIL=20211231;INTERVAL=1;BYDAY=TH
{code}
h3. Workaround

The record should be manually fixed in the database. RECURRENCE_RULE format should be changed from {{UNTIL=YYYYMMDD}} to {{UNTIL=YYYYMMDDTHHMMSSZ}}.

(i) Please ensure that *Confluence is not running* during the database modification to avoid potential data inconsistency.
fields.summary: Creating recurring event with end repeat date does not format properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, admins can restrict the ability for users to view analytics reports in the site through the *General Configuration > Analytics Permissions* page. Space-specific restrictions can also be set in *Space tools > Permissions > Analytics Permissions*.

However, if you don't grant users access to the site's analytics reports but try to add them to the space-specific analytics permissions, they won't go into effect as mentioned in [Administer analytics|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/administer-analytics-1044780575.html]:
{quote}If a Confluence administrator has denied a group permission to view analytics, adding the group at the space level will not grant this permission.
{quote}
This means you must be granted permission to view the site's analytics reports in order to view a space's analytics reports.
h3. Proposed feature

Create a separate permission to allow users to view the analytic reports for a space but not the site itself.
fields.summary: Provide a feature for an admin to grant users access to space analytics but not the full site analytics

Steps to Reproduce # Install Confluence # Create a page with table in it as *Fixed Width* # Fill in long text in the fixed width cell so that it is displayed in more than 1 row {code}


a b cccccccccc
106 aaaa
80 bbb
103 cccccc


{code} !image-2021-08-16-14-26-37-089.png|thumbnail! # Save the page # In View Mode, highlight the table and copy it to other editor app such as #* Microsoft Outlook #* FoxMail #* Gmail (web) #* Hotmail (web) [^copy table from safari.mp4] h3. Expected Results The pasted table is having the same exact width (since it is Fixed Width), layout and formatting as what's in the Confluence page h3. Actual Results The pasted results are different depends on the browsers where the table is copied from: || Safari | Table width adjusted to fit the long text instead of being the same as Confluence page | || Firefox | Having the same issue as Safari as well as the table border is not visible | || Chrome | Pasted content seems to be in plain text with no table format | (i) Copying from different browsers seem to paste into different result. Microsoft Outlook is used used for paste testing in this the screenshot below !image-2021-08-16-14-28-24-833.png|thumbnail! h3. Workaround Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Copying Table from View Mode cannot be pasted into other editors retaining the same format or layout

fields.description: Regulated industries often require audits of permissions, and continually need to update their permissions across many products. Having the ability to manage permissions outside of a "grant" or "add" scenario would be beneficial for many of these customers, since there are times when users or groups need to be explicitly removed rather than granted permission. Adding a subtraction option to the current permission model would allow for more flexibility in these scenarios.
fields.summary: Subtractive Permissions
